title: 1960s British Invasion
description: How well do you remember when British bands conquered the American music charts in the 1960s?

questions.question: Which British band appeared on The Ed Sullivan Show on February 9, 1964, watched by 73 million viewers?
What was The Beatles' first number-one hit in the United States?
options: I Want to Hold Your Hand

questions.question: Which British band had the hit 'Glad All Over' that briefly knocked The Beatles off the UK charts?
What was The Rolling Stones' first U.S. top-ten hit?
Which British band recorded 'The House of the Rising Sun' in 1964?
Peter Noone was the lead singer of which British Invasion band?
Which band had the 1964 hit 'You Really Got Me'?
What was the name of the Liverpool venue where The Beatles famously performed hundreds of times?
Which British band featured Eric Clapton, Jeff Beck, and Jimmy Page at different times?
Gerry and the Pacemakers had a huge hit with which song that became a football anthem?
Which band recorded 'She's Not There' in 1964?
What was the term used by the media to describe the intense fan frenzy around The Beatles?
Which British band had the hit 'Needles and Pins' in 1964?
options: Billy J. Kramer and the Dakotas

questions.question: Dusty Springfield was one of the few solo British Invasion artists. What was her signature hit?
options: I Only Want to Be with You
You Don't Have to Say You Love Me

questions.question: Which Manfred Mann song reached number one in the U.S. in 1964?
